MECHANICAL ENGINEERING INTERN

SUMMARY

Mechanical Engineer Professional offering 25 years of progressive experience within a manufacturing setting.
Experienced project manager that negotiates prices for project, created and implemented preventive/corrective maintenance strategies and completed projects before deadline and under budget.
Maintenance Manager who prioritizes multiple tasks based upon risk and production needs and works well under pressure.
Broad industry experience includes Military, LRV Trains, and industrial manufacturing Highlights Proficient in SolidWorks Facility and plant modifications Root cause analysis Time management skills Project management Cross-disciplinary collaboration Strategic prioritization Familiar with predictive maintenance techniques
Highlights

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manufacturing Engineering Intern

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

The Manufacturing Engineering Intern will provide manufacturing and supply chain support, including fixture and process design, qualification, and improvement for new product introduction and sustainment of existing product lines. Supports manufacturing plant and supply chain performance analysis. Project variety, autonomy, and ownership dependent on individual drive and skillset. Day-to-day tasks will be varied by current need and intern will be working on meaningful/impactful work. The Enovis Intern program requires a 12-week commitment for the summer 2024.

Ideal candidate is junior undergraduate seeking a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical or Biomedical Engineering.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Manufacturing performance analysis and development of related process improvements Engineering support for the launch of new products

Education/Experience

Must complete at least first two years of engineering school and maintain a minimum overall GPA of 3.0Working on completion of BS in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial / Systems Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Materials Science & Engineering or Manufacturing & Mechanical Engineering TechnologyExperience with 3D modeling, physical prototyping and subtractive manufacturing desiredAbility to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals Ability to respond to common inquiries Ability to communicate effectively and technically

Competency

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information.Design - Demonstrates attention to detail.Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification.Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; varies writing style to meet needs; able to read and interpret written information. Writes detailed test protocols/reports.Inquisitive – focused curiosity, ask, “Why?” and “How?” to solve engineering problems.

About Enovis™

Enovis Corporation (NYSE: ENOV) is an innovation-driven medical technology growth company dedicated to developing clinically differentiated solutions that generate measurably better patient outcomes and transform workflows. Powered by a culture of continuous improvement, global talent and innovation, the Company’s extensive range of products, services and integrated technologies fuels active lifestyles in orthopedics and beyond. For more information about Enovis, please visit www.enovis.com.

EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Internship
<JD_END>
